ygData.subject: UNSUBSCRIBE unsubscribe
ygData.msgSnippet: UNSUBSCRIBE unsubscribe ... From:  To:  Sent: Thursday, October 12, 2000 12:59 PM Subject: [eqbards] Digest Number
ygData.messageBody:
UNSUBSCRIBE unsubscribe


----- Original Message -----
From: <eqbards@egroups.com>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 12, 2000 12:59 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Digest Number 1155

with the subject submissions.

> Message: 1
> Date: Thu, 12 Oct 2000 09:09:24 -0400
> From: "Stephen E. McCloskey" <s.mccloskey@...>
> Subject: Re: bards in guilds...
>
> Just one . . . me, almost 31. Besides that there is a level 28, 12 and a
7.
> I did a /who all bard 30 40, /who all bard 41 50, /who all bard 51 60, the
> other day when there were 2400 people on the server and only came up with
a
> total of about 30 people across all 3 searches. =\ More armor for me I
guess!
>
> -Steve
>
>
> At 08:05 AM 10/12/00 -0400, you wrote:
> >Just a quick question. How many bards above 30 are there in your guilds?
> >
> >The more i play, the less bards i realize there are. When i do a /who all
> >bard in my guild, i count 2 bards at the most, me and a lev 52 (unless
> >there's a hidden one somewhere). How sad is that? do a /who all warrior
or
> >any other class in the guild and you'll see on average 7. Mind you in a
> >weird way this is to my advantage as whenever i'm planes capable, i wont
> >have to lotto for imbrued since she's got a full set, a breath of harmony
> >and a partisan. But still, i still wish there were more bards around but
i
> >think the numbers will keep dropping as i read this mailing list 8(
> >................
> >Minkin
> >Valorium
> >Sol Ro
>
>
>

> Message: 2
> Date: Thu, 12 Oct 2000 09:45:00 -0400
> From: Rebecca Small <rsmall@...>
> Subject: Drum model and stuff
>
> Hi all,
>
> The drum thing bugs me. We said in beta, why do we strum a stick? they
> said, it's beta we'll fix it. Release, we still strum a stick, they say we
> forgot to do the drum. Drum gets likened to the barb shield thing, it's
too
> big, maybe we can fix it later. Something like a year later, new lands
(and
> all that modeling) still a stick. Nostrolo's tamborine gets turned into a
> tamborine instead of a stick, all drums are still sticks. Give me odds the
> next addition and the chance to recitfy the drum thing and avoid the large
> d/l (cited as a main drawback to fixing) still won't have a drum. I've
> played a bard for 2 years as of next month, and that seems like a damn
long
> time for something to be outstanding. It says they either don't care or
they
> are simply unable to deal with the volume of problems they have. Granted I
> am a perfectionist, and spent 15 years in Nuclear Maintenance to make it
> worse. We tracked outstanding issues based on severity AND the length of
> time the issue was outstanding. The NRC is very interested in cycle times.
> The point was long cycle times says the management of the facility was
> lacking in commitment and efficiency, and would get a plant on the Watch
> list as fast as a real incident. Gaming is not nuclear power of course,
but
> the same indicators apply to any industry.
>
> On another topic, I have been in Sebilis the last 2 weekends. My cleric
and
> I either join a group or form one. When no enchanter is available, I have
> been doing the crowd control. My best is to charm one, have it fight the
> second or use the 53 mez. The best I can do is 2 mobs mez'ed. I just don't
> seem to have time to get a 3rd effectively. I was actually down to one
> bubble of mana left at one point, and we were just at bridge 3. The pickup
> wizard was annoyed that I wasn't singing clarity the whole time. :)
>
> Brilinnia Ban'Sidhe (one bubble on 53)
> Excalibur, Xegony
>
>
> ________________________________________________________________________
> ________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 3
> Date: Thu, 12 Oct 2000 10:02:31 -0400
> From: "Stephen E. McCloskey" <s.mccloskey@...>
> Subject: Re: Drum model and stuff
>
> I often wonder if we should even be asking for Verant to fix the drums.
> After all, look at the duck waddle we have after the "fix". The drum
> animation that Verant comes out with could be just as bad if not worse.
Do
> we really want to take that chance?! Not me!
>
> -Steve
>

the

long

they
> >are simply unable to deal with the volume of problems they have. Granted
I
> >am a perfectionist, and spent 15 years in Nuclear Maintenance to make it
> >worse. We tracked outstanding issues based on severity AND the length of
> >time the issue was outstanding. The NRC is very interested in cycle
times.
> >The point was long cycle times says the management of the facility was

> Message: 4
> Date: Thu, 12 Oct 2000 10:23:20 -0400
> From: "Legba Work" <mattdeba@...>
> Subject: Re: Abashi finally responds... sort of
>
> Our mez song ig useful till at least lvl 30. I say this because in my
> cleric's group (which is now lvl 30) our bard still uses lullaby
effectivly.
> I'm not sure when it becomes useless (Elfson just about never used it
> because high taunt factor in pickup groups was too risky for him), but it
> has some use at least. Pixie Strike on the other hand is pretty weak for
> mezzing. Though I still love the song for its stun effect. My guild (who
I
> now spend most of my time grouped with) was shocked when a healer mob bot
> off a heal in combat. "Elf, what did you fall asleep there?" (I actually
> didn't knwo the mob was a healer thus wasn't stunning).
>
> But that shows how useful that song is, my guild just assumes that every
> heal is going to get interupted. (Obviously not just me doing it). SO
that
> song is still useful.
>
> Face the facts, we knew a month ago we would never get to mez at higher
> levels. Live with it. I don't know why you masochistly read Gordon's
> posts anymore. You know what he's going to say.
>
>
>
> ________________________________________________________________________
> ________________________________________________________________________

> Message: 7
> Date: Thu, 12 Oct 2000 10:38:01 -0400
> From: "Legba Work" <mattdeba@...>
> Subject: Re: Abashi finally responds... sort of
>
> Heh not friendly for groups?
>
> Screech: Any bard who goes into a dungeon where you may have to evac
should
> have this memmed. Also ever fear/snare in burning woods? Its more
> effective than a balanced group of 6 fighting the mobs straight up there.
> We even have sold our cleric on the idea, and he just blasts the mobs now
> (and heals when things go awry.
>
> Chains: I always have this memmed in dungeons too. Why? Because stuff
> happens. Your ranger goes LD before snaring. Someone screws up and roots
> the mob (breaking snare). There is no snarer in the group (or your snarer
> is too low). In any case NOBODY else can chase down a mob while casting
> snare in an emrgency. (Is there a junark armor with snare? If so make
that
> nobody a bit smaller)
>
> Songof the Sirens: You have to be kidding me. This is our most powerful
> song (till higher lvl then its the 39 charm song). Worse case of this
song
> is you have one mob damaging the mob the parry is on rather than you 90%
of
> the time. Best case, you have 2 mobs beating on each other, while the
party
> kills a third. Oh yea, tell the enchanter who has half a bub of life when
> you charm the mob off him (giving the healer time to heal) that you
> shouldn;t mem the song when he's around. I cannot count the number of
> enchanters/healers/over blasters I have saved with this song.
>
> Clouding: Ok here there are some problems, BUT an organzied group can use
> this song amazingly well. Player 1 walks, leading the group to their camp
> in the dungeon. Rest of group, inlcuding bard singing clouding follows.
> Player 2 who also knows the way "sweeps" behind the group making sure all
> stay close.
>
>
>
> ________________________________________________________________________
> ________________________________________________________________________
>

> Message: 12
> Date: Thu, 12 Oct 2000 08:21:04 -0700 (PDT)
> From: Joanna Wright <Centiera@...>
> Subject: Re: The last 4 digests
>
> :P Ok, so I didn't check my e-mail for 2 days and you
> all get chatty. I see how it is...
>
> Alrighty, as to why working as intended isn't good
> enough: Simple answer is gameplay. I've heard horror
> stories of people trying to use the 51 (52?) travel
> song only to have one member get hit and fall to their
> death. I've also heard this song won't stack with
> dead man floating which would fix the problems with
> this song right there.
>
> What a lot of these songs should do (45th song, the
> travel song, etc) is create more than one spell icon.
> The upper level haste song that has the DS on it
> should have the damage shield component seperate.
> >From what I've heard, the DS is lost so quickly thus
> canceling the whole song effect that upper level bards
> simply switch to an earlier haste song.
>
> That's why these "working as intended" songs were a
> good idea but bad reality.
>
> Abashi's comments about our singing steel pissed me
> off even more. Exactly what are we balanced against
> right now? The warrior Cobalt is something I'd love
> to have. Don't most of the pieces have healing
> properties in the form of self buffs to them? I'd
> really love to know what moron thought the helm,
> pants, and boots effects were balanced.
>
> The reason why lots of the older bards are still
> chaffing at the whole lullaby issue is indeed how it
> used to work. But it's also how Verant decided to
> handle that whole issue. We have the head magic guy
> at the time publicly stating it seems messed up.
> We're told to wait patiently which we do, for 6 to 8
> months. In that time the break another song but fix
> it. Then they break that song again and refuse to fix
> it. Then they have a mouthpiece come out and say
> she'll get to the bottom of this who promptly tells us
> some lame excuse about how it's never supposed to have
> been useable after 30th. So where's the upgrade of
> lullaby around 29th???
>
> If you're a bard that was around when you could use
> lullaby as it used to be, you're more than likely
> pretty pissed off right now. The reason is because 2
> classes (shaman and cleric) has essentially had their
> own lullaby issue come up and it either got fixed or
> is getting fixed. Mark of Karn was nerfed, they
> suggested fixes, and Verant went with the one the
> clerics wanted. BTW, the fix wasn't one of the options
> Verant gave them. All that got done in about a week.
> It seems now the shamen have gotten Verant to look
> into their uber weapon. How much you wanna bet they
> get a fix close to what the shamen as a whole will be
> happy with?
>
> Since I'm one of those bards who got to play with
> lullaby, you're asking if I'm so livid, why do I play
> a bard? Mainly cause none of my secondaries are close
> to 45. However, I've heard is said you can get a
> warrior to close to that in 2 months or so. Mine's
> 13th in 3 of my regular play days. Oh, and with
> bandages, I'm soloing. I figure a shaman is probably
> closer to being a bard but I just don't like how
> female barbarians look. Hehe, and I am a true bard
> when it comes to astetics :P (I saw an absolutely
> perfect combo. Runed mithril tunic with BI leggins,
> arms, boots, gloves and a leather helm. The half-elf
> wearing it looked great. Mithril BP, arms, and
> leggings with singing steel bracers, gauntlets, helm
> and boots looks awesome too.)
>
> Anyway, to sum up, Abashi is full of it, I'm bitter,
> and I think it's perfectly acceptable to make choices
> in armor that cut down your AC but 100 to 150 points
> or so in the name a fashion :) Another valueable post
> from me, lol!
>
> OH! I do remember dragonrealms too. I was a warrior
> mage there. It was 9.95 a month but you could upgrade
> to 29.95 a month to get access to better hunting
> areas, and your own house. Was a good game but the
> people who ran it angered me to no end and I left when
> an alternative came out (taps foot waiting for Anarchy
> Online's release date).
>
> OH! Something else I remembered while proof reading.
> There was a post on whineplay from a bard complaining
> about a stealth nerf on selo's. Reports were
> conflicting about it so I blew off that issue.
> Yesterday I noticed selo's acceleration got noticeably
> faster. Kinda like someone broke something and just
> fixed it maybe? /rude Verant
>
> Centiera D'Winter
> 45th Half-elf Bard
> Cesca
> 13th Half-Elf Warrior
> Litharia
> 23rd High Elf Cleric
>
> PS- I have 3 friends who are female barb shamen so I'm
> not anti-female barb, it's just not something I'd like
> to play.
>

> Message: 21
> Date: Thu, 12 Oct 2000 09:06:54 -0700 (PDT)
> From: Ioshua <Ioshua@...>
> Subject: Strength analysis (was: Abashi finally responds... sort of)
>
> ATK is made of two numbers, yes. The eq.castersrealm.com shaman forums
> (as well as Shaman's Curcible and I think another) occasionally have
> long discussons on the values of stats. Tumadorf is big on numbers and
> tight analysis, well written and all around in the know.
>
> This thread contains a graph of 6 different strengths, from 55 - 228
> showing not much more than random variance and a spike at the magic
> number and 1 damage frequency as one would expect.
> http://forums.castersrealm.com/eq/Forum12/HTML/000452.html
> A somewhat ugly graphical representation surrounded by a nice text
> analysis. It doesn't sit too well with me but I can't nail down why.
>
> One thing I see people commenting on is, why higher strength gives a
> lower average damage and more hits for 1. Ugh, lower average damage
> because of the hits for 1 and more hits for 1 because the +str bumps
> them up from a 0 damage hit (miss). It's a shame we can't always tell
> the difference between an avoided miss and a mitigated 0 damage hit.
>
> Just as a point of curiousity:
> How often do you, as a bard, get ridden for +str songs? I haven't gone
> out of my way to use one lately except when I'm smithing. After looking
> at how little +str effects overall damage (unless in a really melee
> heavy party) I stick with a haste effect (if no enchanter or I'm not
> busy doing everything else) or damage shields or dots depending on
> situation. However, I've only just hit 42 and haven't had a chance to
> try out McVaxius' yet so everything might change after I give it a
> whirl.
>
> --- Jeffrey Sue <jsue@...> wrote:
> > i actually have a few questions about this stuff.
> > +1 str == +1 atk right?
> >
> > now, is atk like ac in that it is made of up 2 numbers, like chance
> > to hit, and damage
> > done, sorta like damage avoidance and damage absorption? if so, then
> > real damage
> > applied would also have to increase.
> >
> > anyone got a good link to the analysis done on this?
>
>
>
